comments.creator: smiler@lanil.mine.nu
comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-US; rv:1.5a) Gecko/20030814 Mozilla Firebird/0.6.1
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-US; rv:1.5a) Gecko/20030814 Mozilla Firebird/0.6.1

When you type in an application to open a file with it should accept commandline
parameters.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Try downloading a file with MIME-type audio/x-scpls
2. Type in /usr/bin/xmms -e
Actual Results:  
Browser gives an error that "/usr/bin/xmms -e" could not be found.

Expected Results:  
It should run /usr/bin/xmms and passing -e as a commandline parameter.
comments.author: smiler@lanil.mine.nu

comments.raw_text:
sorry for bugspam, long-overdue mass reassign of ancient QA contact bugs,
filter on "beltznerLovesGoats" to get rid of this mass change
comments.author: mconnor@mozilla.com
comments.text:
sorry for bugspam, long-overdue mass reassign of ancient QA contact bugs,
filter on "beltznerLovesGoats" to get rid of this mass change
We're moving in the direction of only allowing the OS default to open files you download, so I don't think custom options here are going to be implemented at any point.
comments.author: gijskruitbosch+bugs@gmail.com
